alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pulaski, northwestern Floyd and south central Montgomery Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Indian Valley, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Floyd... Indian Valley... Pilot... Alum Ridge... and Copper Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
